name: Charles Bukowski
movement: None. Some have attempted to classify him under the'Beats', the 'Meat School', 'Transgressional Fiction and 'Dirty Realism'.
influences: Anton Chekhov, James Thurber, Franz Kafka, Knut Hamsun, Ernest Hemingway, John Fante, Louis-Ferdinand Céline, Robinson Jeffers, Fyodor Dostoyevsky, D. H. Lawrence, Ezra Pound, Conrad Aiken, Sherwood Anderson, Catullus, Li Bai, Antonin Artaud   '''Henry Charles Bukowski''' (August 16 1920 – March 9 1994), a German-American poet and novelist, who gained fame, phenomenal sales and critical recognition in Europe but continues to be mostly ignored by the American literary establishment. Bukowski's writing was heavily influenced by the geography and atmosphere of his home city of Los Angeles, California
NAME: Bukowski, Charles  |ALTERNATIVE
